findings.title: Usage Of transfer Instead Of safeTransfer
findings.description: The ERC20 standard token implementation functions return the transaction status as a Boolean. It's good practice to check for the return status of the function call to ensure that the transaction was successful.

findings.title: For Loop Over Dynamic Array
findings.description: The contract uses for loops to iterate over dynamic arrays, which can lead to gas costs and potential reentrancy issues.

findings.title: Missing address verification
findings.description: Certain functions lack a safety check in the address, the address-type argument should include a zero-address test, otherwise, the contract's functionality may become inaccessible or tokens may be burned in perpetuity.

findings.title: Usage Of block.timestamp
findings.description: Block.timestamp is used in the contract. The variable block is a set of variables. The timestamp does not always reflect the current time and may be inaccurate.
